story:
Bref résumé

Ce projet vise à apporter l'indépendance alimentaire et énergétique partout dans le monde, là où le besoin est le plus urgent (en tant que Québécois, j'aimerais beaucoup commencer dans le Nord du Québec, où des peuples autochtones doivent commander leur nourriture par avion, et où l'insécurité alimentaire est courante). Il vise à éliminer notre dépendance face à l'État, à rendre l'austérité insignifiante et à faire de la pauvreté un concept du passé. À nous apporter l'indépendance nécessaire pour être un peuple libre. Libre de travail, libre d'énergies sales et de destruction de la nature dont nous faisons partie. Libre de vivre durablement et intelligemment, avec toutes les technologies qui sont à notre disposition mais qu'on tente de nous cacher.  Il vise à éliminer ces façons destructrices de faire les choses, non pas en les supprimant pour nous laisser dans le néant et l'incompréhension, mais plutôt en construisant des alternatives auxquelles nous pouvons adhérer. C'est un organisme public, qui n'appartient à personne et qui est toujours ouvert à d'autres projets à l'échelle internationale, avec comme principal but de libérer la planète et ses formes de vies de leur exploitation. Soit en démarrant des projets de:

  • Serres solaires passives
  • Agriculture Verticale
  • Permaculture
  • Panneaux solaires
  • Éoliennes
  • Énergie libre
  • Culture et transformation du chanvre

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

  • Le montant pour que le projet se réalise n'est pas clair, et n'a probablement pas de limite, puisqu'il vise à apporter un changement concret dans le monde entier. Il faudra d'abord que les peuples acceptent de recevoir l'aide de Free People (si ça n'arrive pas, l'indépendance alimentaire et énergétique sera tout simplement donnée ailleurs, aux occupations de l'Appel de l'Est, ou à tout autre groupe de militant-e-s qui souhaitent déclarer faire partie d'une terre exploitée, par exemple).
  • Une partie des fonds servira à payer le billet d'avion pour se rendre aux endroits inaccessibles par la terre ferme. 
  • Nous utiliserons le plus possible de matériaux recyclés, pour gérer les fonds le mieux possible et pour prouver que c'est possible de subvenir à nos besoins en travaillant la terre. (Par exemple, des pneus, du bois et des fenêtres pour faire un Earthship se trouvent facilement dans des dépotoirs.
  • Une autre partie servira à financer de l'équipement audiovisuel pour propager le travail de Free People à l'échelle de la planète.

L'impact

  • Ce projet possède ce qu'il faut pour nous sortir du système actuel, et à nous assurer que nos besoins de base seront comblés si jamais celui-ci s'écroule. 
  • Il a le potentiel de nous montrer qu'il est possible de vivre sans argent, que d'autres façons de vivre sont possibles et qu'un retour aux sources nous permettrait de libérer la planète de cet esclavage corporatif.
  • Il peut montrer la voie sur comment boycotter toutes les industries que nous souhaiterions voir disparaitre.
  • J'ai déjà rejoint beaucoup de gens avec mes paroles et réalisé que tout le monde veut la même chose, mais personne ne sait comment s'y prendre. Ils attendent de se faire montrer comment faire. (Je l'ai vu suite aux réactions à ce vidéo que j'ai réalisé il y a quelques mois :  https://consciencehumaniterre.wordpress.com/201... ) La meilleure façon de convaincre les autres d'adhérer à d'autres façons de vivre n'est pas seulement d'en parler, mais d'y adhérer soi-même et de prouver que c'est possible. Nous n'avons pas besoin d'être une majorité, seulement d'être un assez grand nombre qui effectue ce virage au cœur même des villes et des villages qui existent déjà.
  • J'ai déjà expérimenté le fait d'investir de son temps et de travailler pour le bien-être et le bonheur des autres en faisant une épicerie gratuite, pendant environ 2 mois, presque à chaque jour à Montréal. Je m'installait à des endroits particuliers, soit au Parc Émilie-Gamelin, au Square Saint-Louis, où tout simplement près de l'endroit où j'habitais temporairement. Avec l'aide de quelques amis, nous avons aussi fait quelques repas du style Food Not Bombs, et nous mangions avec tous ceux qui passaient par là, en chantant et en parlant de solutions et d'entraide. J'ai réalisé que si je voulais voir plus d'entraide, d'unité et de collectivisme, je devais l'incarner. Ces moments, où certain-e-s ont pleuré de joie d'avoir quelqu'un qui les écoutait et qui prenait soin d'eux, humainement, et non pas en voyant ça comme un devoir forcé, ont été les plus beaux moments de ma vie. J'ai vraiment appris à me soucier du bonheur et du confort des autres avant même de penser au mien. De toute façons, celui-ci est devenu une condition pour le mien. Ubuntu : je suis parce-que nous sommes. Je fournissais également les occupations #OccupeToute des cégeps, principalement au cégep Saint-Laurent, mais aussi quelques fois au cégep du Vieux-Montréal et au cégep Maisonneuve. J'ai donc vraiment envie de pousser cette implication à un autre niveau.
  • J'ai tenté de faire ce virage à l'OccupeToute du Cégep de Saint-Laurent (https://www.facebook.com/glune/videos/102060575...), en les convainquant de continuer l'occupation pour l'été et de prouver que nous pouvions subvenir à nos besoins sans avoir accès au cégep pour l'eau, la douche et l'électricité. J'avais entrepris de construire une douche solaire (avec un gallon d'eau peinturé en noir au bouchon percé, et une toile fixée sur un hula-hoop, le tout reposant sur une structure en bois récupéré), un four solaire (avec une boîte et du papier d'aluminium), des récupérateurs d'eau de pluie (des toiles étirées au maximum, en forme d'entonnoir, avec un trou et un baril en dessous). Un grand jardin était déjà cultivé par certains élèves du cégep. Nous avions aussi récupéré beaucoup de pneus, ce qui me donnait envie d'entreprendre la construction d'un Earthship (je possède le DVD de Solutions Era qui explique comment s'y prendre). Seulement, il y a eu un manque d'intérêt, de motivation ou de compréhension de l'impact que pourrait avoir l'occupation, et celle-ci a pris fin, suite à un vote (je n'étais pas présent cette journée-là pour défendre mon point de vue ou tout simplement voter).

Risques et défis

  • Il se pourrait que certain-e-s tentent de profiter du financement que Free People recevra pour se payer des voyages gratuits. Il faudrait alors s'assurer que les intentions des participants sont bonnes et qu'ils emmèneront véritablement l'indépendance alimentaire et énergétique. Je ne sais pas comment y arriver, je laisse donc cette question ouverte. Tout ce que je sais, c'est que si ça arrive, ça prouverait que cette personne est égoïste à un plus haut point et aurait prouvé qu'elle n'a aucune humanité, et que le malheur des autres la laisse dans la plus grande indifférence. 
  • Un autre défi sera de s'assurer que les spécialistes de l'agriculture ou de l'énergie ont vraiment les capacités qu'ils disent posséder. Il faudrait donc des preuves à l'appui.
  • Il se pourrait que certain-e-s se blessent. Il faudrait donc s'assurer de toujours avoir une trousse de premiers soins sur place. 
  • Il est possible que l'État tente de défendre les terres qu'il dit posséder. Il faudra donc être conscients que nos projets peuvent être détruits. Si ça arrive, il faudra se fier sur la conscience de tous et toutes pour supporter nos actions et condamner celles de l'État, qui tenterait de nous forcer à revenir dans le système en train de sombrer dans le néant, ce qui serait une attaque contre l'humanité, ainsi que la charte des droits et libertés.
  • Il se peut que des pays dans le besoin soient en guerre. Il faudra donc prendre les précautions nécessaires pour assurer que les endroits visités soient sécuritaires.

D'autres façons d'aider

  • Aimez la page facebook de Free People Project. Partagez le projet, prononcez-vous sur votre envie de vivre de d'autre façons et appliquez-les à votre vie.
  • Devenez autosuffisant. Libérez-vous de votre dépendance au système et montez aux autres à le faire à travers vos actions. Faites votre jardin, votre serre, votre énergie verte.
  • Envoyez le progrès que vous faites, ou que vous voyez à travers votre communauté, à la page facebook Free People ou à free_people@riseup.net
  • Boycottez les industries destructrices, n'achetez plus de produits emballés, ni aucun produit du pétrole. Supportez l'économie locale, les ressources renouvelables et écologiques comme les produits du chanvre.
  • Aidez votre prochain. Nourrissez quelqu'un dans le besoin, ou quelqu'un au hasard. Souriez à un premier inconnu, dites bonjour au deuxième, parlez au troisième.
  • Méditez. Envoyez des énergies positives dans l'univers qui nous enveloppe.
  • Parlez de conscience, de solutions, d'entraide et de nouvelles façons de vivre avec les gens que vous croisez. Vous réaliserez que tout le monde pense sensiblement pareil. Éduquez les autres, laissez-vous éduquer, discutez, ayez des moments humains. Aimez.

Et le tour est joué.

story:
Who is Amir Hekmati?

Born in Arizona and raised in Michigan, Amir Hekmati is a former Marine who visited Iran for the first time in August of 2011 to visit his aging grandmother. He was in Iran two weeks when Iranian intelligence officials detained him and accused him of being a spy for the CIA, an allegation often used against dual-nationals by Iranian officials.

In January of 2012, he was given a closed-door trial that lasted only a few hours and sentenced to death on the charges of working with a hostile country (the US), Corrupting the Earth, and Waging War Against God. 

In March of 2012, his sentence was overturned on appeal, with an Iranian judiciary ruling there was insufficent evidence. A new trial was ordered. That trial has yet to take place.

For over 16 months, Amir suffered his detention in the notorious Evin prison in solitary confinement. He was not allowed visits with his relatives in Iran. He had little to no access to his Iranian attorney. His family in America received no letters or calls, and any packages sent to Amir were not given to him. 

Recently he was transferred to a new unit within Evin prison after going on a month long hunger strike that left him to be found by guards on the floor, unconscious.

During his imprisonment, his father, a professor in Michigan, received news that he was fighting terminal brain cancer. For several months, Amir was not aware of his father's condition, only finding out recently. His father's fear is that Amir will continue to languish in Evin prison while his health slips away and that he will never get to hold his son in his arms again. 

He has been held in Evin prison for over 800 days.

Fundraising Efforts

Former Westerners held in prison in Iran have stated that their freedom came from awareness of their imprisonment and when the international community raised their voices when Evin's walls kept them silent. The Amir Hekmati Freedom Campaign is seeking to raise funds to be spent domestically to continue to raise Amir's case in the media, with elected officials, and with the general public through social media, visits to elected officials and ambassadors in Washington D.C., and media campaigns in local, national, and international press, as well as benefits held on Amir's behalf. It will also help fund materials necessary for Amir's campaign, such as signs, posters, press releases, website costs, and other fees incurred in the almost two year fight for Amir's freedom.

story:
EDIT : We have reach our goal but its not over. As you know the situation here is terrible and we always have something to work on, so please continue to donate and share. 


Nous avons atteint le but que nous nous étions fixé! Mais au vue de la situation, toute somme supplémentaire sera la bienvenue et sera utilisée pour les enfants!  Continuez à donner et à partager!!!!! MERCI



The center / Le centre 



French Version

(English version above)

Qui sommes-nous?


Bonjour à tous, Nous sommes Yamin et Dounia, nous sommes actuellement volontaire dans une ONG canado-palestinienne, Project Hope à Naplouse, en Palestine. En tant que volontaire, nous enseignons le français et l'anglais dans différent programmes gérés par Project Hope dans tous Naplouse et dans les environs.  Nous sommes en Palestine depuis 1 mois maintenant et nous nous plaisons réellement ici, les gens sont parmi les plus chaleureux que nous avons eu la chance de rencontrer. Malgré les privations et l'occupation, ils sont prêts à tout partager avec vous même le peu qu'ils ont et cela en gardant toujours le sourire!


 

Le Camp de réfugiés de Balata & le centre Najer Aloja

Il y a plus de 20000 réfugiés recensés à Balata, ce qui en fait l'un des camps les plus densément peuplé en Cisjordanie.

Nous (tous les volontaires) enseignons différentes choses dans différents centres. Anglais, français, du théâtre et même de la zumba! Je peux vous assurer que ces enfants sont toujours enthousiastes et très excités à l'idée d'apprendre!  Notre travaillons bénévolement et les cours sont bien entendu gratuits pour les enfants. 
Le seul problème rencontré est l'état du centre Naher Aloja, la salle de classe est vide, il n'y a rien, pas de bureaux, ni de fournitures et même pas de fenêtres. Malgré cela, ils continuent de venir et de sourire!

 Pourquoi nous récoltons des fonds et pour en faire quoi? 

Comme vous pouvez le voir sur les photos, le centre est plutôt vide. Notre but ici est de l'équiper avec des fournitures de bases ( tableaux, bureaux, rafraîchir les murs, des feutres et papiers pour les enfants). 

Nous ne demandons pas beaucoup! Nous espérons récolter 500 euros pour ce projet. Ces enfants sont heureux avec un nouveau feutre, alors imaginez la joie que ce serait pour eux de pouvoir apprendre dans une vraie salle de classe digne de ce nom! 

Peinture et peintre : 120€

15 Bureau et Chaise 20€ x 15 = 300€

Tableau blanc 40€

Armoire avec cadenas 40€

Fourniture de base ( feuilles, cahiers, feutres …) 50€

Total =  550€

SI vous ne pouvez pas vous permettre de donner, partager simplement cette campagne avec vos amis, votre famille et collègues. Si jamais nous obtenons plus que demandé, l'argent sera reversé à des ONG locales ici en Naplouse et en Palestine qui œuvrent à l'éducation des enfants. 



English Version 

Who are we ?

Hello all, We are Yamin and Dounia, we are French and currently Volunteers with the Palestinian-Canadian NGO Project Hope. As volunteers, we mainly teach English and French in different programs run by Project Hope in various areas within the city of Nablus, in Palestine. We have been in Palestine for 1 month now and really enjoy living here. The people are among the warmest that we have had the chance to meet. Despite the occupation and the subsequent deprivation they are willing to share everything they have with you, and are always smiling.

Balata refugee camp & center:

There are over 20,000 registered refugees in Balata, making it the most highly populated camp in the West Bank. The camp was founded in 1950 and is approximately 2.5 square kilometres.


We ( all the volunteers ) teach different kind of classes in Balata, from English and French to Drama and Zumba ( Yes Zumba ! ). We can honestly say that the kids are so full of enthusiasm and are very eager to learn. Our programme is voluntary and free for the children, and they are so excited to come to class everyday! The only issue is that the center where we hold the classes is very poorly equipped and they have very few amenities; no desks, no furniture, no windows, yet in spite of this the children continue to come to class and to smile through the hardship.


Why are we Fundraising & what do we need and want?


As you can see in the picture, the center is fairly empty. Our goal here is to provide it with basic furniture and to freshen it up a little.
We are not asking for much- we need to raise about 550 Euro in total for this project. These kids get excited when they have a new pen in class, so imagine how thrilled they would be to have a fully furnished center!


Recap of what we need and cost estimation :

Painting material 120€
15 desk & chairs 20€ x 15 = 300€
White board 40€
Closet with padlock 40€
Basic Resources ( Pens, felt pens, paper … ) 50 €
If you can't afford to give anything, please share this campaign with your friends, family and colleagues. Any excess money will be donated to a good cause here in Palestine and for child related issues.



Lets do it !
story_txt:
EDIT : We have reach our goal but its not over. As you know the situation here is terrible and we always have something to work on, so please continue to donate and share. 

Nous avons atteint le but que nous nous étions fixé! Mais au vue de la situation, toute somme supplémentaire sera la bienvenue et sera utilisée pour les enfants!  Continuez à donner et à partager!!!!! MERCI



The center / Le centre 





French Version
(English version above)

Qui sommes-nous?
Bonjour à tous, Nous sommes Yamin et Dounia, nous sommes actuellement volontaire dans une ONG canado-palestinienne, Project Hope à Naplouse, en Palestine. En tant que volontaire, nous enseignons le français et l'anglais dans différent programmes gérés par Project Hope dans tous Naplouse et dans les environs.  Nous sommes en Palestine depuis 1 mois maintenant et nous nous plaisons réellement ici, les gens sont parmi les plus chaleureux que nous avons eu la chance de rencontrer. Malgré les privations et l'occupation, ils sont prêts à tout partager avec vous même le peu qu'ils ont et cela en gardant toujours le sourire!



 


Le Camp de réfugiés de Balata & le centre Najer Aloja
Il y a plus de 20000 réfugiés recensés à Balata, ce qui en fait l'un des camps les plus densément peuplé en Cisjordanie.
Nous (tous les volontaires) enseignons différentes choses dans différents centres. Anglais, français, du théâtre et même de la zumba! Je peux vous assurer que ces enfants sont toujours enthousiastes et très excités à l'idée d'apprendre!  Notre travaillons bénévolement et les cours sont bien entendu gratuits pour les enfants. Le seul problème rencontré est l'état du centre Naher Aloja, la salle de classe est vide, il n'y a rien, pas de bureaux, ni de fournitures et même pas de fenêtres. Malgré cela, ils continuent de venir et de sourire!




 Pourquoi nous récoltons des fonds et pour en faire quoi? 

Comme vous pouvez le voir sur les photos, le centre est plutôt vide. Notre but ici est de l'équiper avec des fournitures de bases ( tableaux, bureaux, rafraîchir les murs, des feutres et papiers pour les enfants). 
Nous ne demandons pas beaucoup! Nous espérons récolter 500 euros pour ce projet. Ces enfants sont heureux avec un nouveau feutre, alors imaginez la joie que ce serait pour eux de pouvoir apprendre dans une vraie salle de classe digne de ce nom! 

Peinture et peintre : 120€
15 Bureau et Chaise 20€ x 15 = 300€
Tableau blanc 40€
Armoire avec cadenas 40€
Fourniture de base ( feuilles, cahiers, feutres …) 50€
Total =  550€

SI vous ne pouvez pas vous permettre de donner, partager simplement cette campagne avec vos amis, votre famille et collègues. Si jamais nous obtenons plus que demandé, l'argent sera reversé à des ONG locales ici en Naplouse et en Palestine qui œuvrent à l'éducation des enfants. 






English Version 


Who are we ?

Hello all, We are Yamin and Dounia, we are French and currently Volunteers with the Palestinian-Canadian NGO Project Hope. As volunteers, we mainly teach English and French in different programs run by Project Hope in various areas within the city of Nablus, in Palestine. We have been in Palestine for 1 month now and really enjoy living here. The people are among the warmest that we have had the chance to meet. Despite the occupation and the subsequent deprivation they are willing to share everything they have with you, and are always smiling.




Balata refugee camp & center:There are over 20,000 registered refugees in Balata, making it the most highly populated camp in the West Bank. The camp was founded in 1950 and is approximately 2.5 square kilometres. We ( all the volunteers ) teach different kind of classes in Balata, from English and French to Drama and Zumba ( Yes Zumba ! ). We can honestly say that the kids are so full of enthusiasm and are very eager to learn. Our programme is voluntary and free for the children, and they are so excited to come to class everyday! The only issue is that the center where we hold the classes is very poorly equipped and they have very few amenities;  no desks, no furniture, no windows, yet in spite of this  the children continue to come to class and to smile through the hardship.Why are we Fundraising & what do we need and want?As you can see in the picture, the center is fairly empty. Our goal here is to provide it with basic furniture and to freshen it up a little.We are not asking for much- we need to raise about 550 Euro in total for this project. These kids get excited when they have a new pen in class, so imagine how thrilled they would be to have a fully furnished center!Recap of what we need and cost estimation : Painting material   120€15 desk & chairs  20€ x 15 = 300€White board 40€Closet with padlock 40€Basic Resources ( Pens, felt pens, paper … )  50 €If you can't afford to give anything, please share this campaign with your friends, family and colleagues. Any excess money will be donated to a good cause here in Palestine and for child related issues.



Lets do it !

story:
Here it is a brand new year!!! It is going to be a fun exciting one for all of us. Think positive and move forward in 2013 with intention and you will be pleasantly surprised just how quickly thoughts become reality. Now with that being said I am on a mission of my own to raise some much needed funds.

If all goes well with my fundraising efforts, this will be my 3rd year going to WinterBLindCamp. Supporting funds have been remarkably slow compared to other years. So I have turned to the wonders of the interenet!

I look forward all year long to participate in activites such as sking, snowshowing, sledding, tubing and singing by the campfire with my camp friends I get to see once a year.

This is an awesome opportunity for me to meet old and new friends that have similiar disabilities. It sure gives me a warm sense of community.

My name is Frank Larkin, I am a legally blind resident of this community and have the opportunity to attend The Christian Record Services/National  Camps For The Blind, “WinterCamp 2013”. The camp will be hosted in Grayling Michigan from February 3rd– 10th, 2013. CRS/NCB covers all the expenses for the week of camp except for the return transportation.

I thank you for your donation. Small or Large it means the world to me. God Bless <3

The camp will be hosted in Grayling Michigan from February 3rd – 10th,2013. CRS/NCB covers all the expenses for the week of camp except for the return transportation. The cost for the return trip to Blind Winter Camp will be approximately $1,600 as shown in the chart below.

Return Airfare                                                                $800

 

Return Bus Costs from Oshawa-Grayling                     $200

 

2 Nights Hotel (while travelling to & from Grayling)  $300

 

10 Meals                                                                          $300

                                                                                        

 Total amount required for travel                                $1,600

You may contribute online, in person or by mail.

If you like you can stop by the CNIB office in Charlottetown and drop off a donation or you may mail it to Frank Larkin 27 Richmond apt. 5 Charlottetown PE C1A1H5

If you have any questions feel free to contact me @ 902.367.5735 or the CNIB 1 Greensview Drive Charlottetown PEI. Contact: Chrissy Penny Phone: (902)566-2580 email: Chrissy.penny@cnib.ca

story: .

Take the Kids to the Sea

I am Varisa Sinthusake, one of volunteers of this project. I used to work along Thai-Myanmar border and have continued my ideology to work close to migrants and refugees in social development organizations. Today, I am trying to raise fund for this year's project which will be held on 3-7 May, 2018 in the southern beach of Thailand.

Background of this project started when 30 volunteers went up on the mountain along Thai-Myanmar border in 2012 to help migrant/ and or refugee family and children built earthen school and learning centers. While we were learning about inequality, poverty and human rights problems, we also experience love and faith from innocent people who seek asylum and fled from places they used to call home. Most children would appear normal to other people. They helped us building their own school by that time. They were asked to sculpt the decoration on the earthen wall of each classroom. One of our volunteers walked around to see how they did and found the sculpture of the man pointing a gun to another man who already lied down on the ground. Our friend urgently took that sculpture out and replaced it with flower sculpture. What I am trying to tell the world is that these children might look like normal kids, but they were vulnerable inside. After that trip, we made strong bond with all these pure hearts people and would like to contribute something for them, and of course for us too.

"Take the kids to the sea" project has started in 2012 with all helps only from friends and some people who know about this project. Our volunteer group take 7-15 year-old students from 4 schools in Umphang and Mae sot, Tak, Thailand to the eastern beach of Thailand. Each trip take them 16 hours in total traveling from the mountain high of west of Thailand to the beach located in the east of Thailand so that each kid can experience playing in the sea for the first time of their lives.

Where do donations go? 

1) Transportation cost (vehicle and fuel) for 40 children, 4 teachers and 2 drivers to travel round trip from the school and back to school after the trip.

2) Accommodation for 5 days and 4 nights in the camp. (This year, we plan to book the accommodation in Prachuabkirikhan province, south of Thailand)

3) Food and drinks for 40 children, 4 teachers and 2 drivers. Exclude volunteers.

4) Teachers and drivers stipends.

5) Equipment for activities in the camp.

6) After this project, all remaining donations will go to migrant learning centers in Umphang, Thailand

The Impact

After 5 years of "Take the Kids to the Sea" project, we got to see all those happy faces. They got opportunities. But on the top of that, they get to see the world and realize that they have all those basic human rights equally as others.

story:
The Access to Information Programme (AIP) has been working for over 20 years for free access to government held information in Bulgaria as a prerequisite for exercising other rights, public participation and civil control on the Government. 

The Right to Know Day was established in 2002 at an international conference in Sofia, Bulgaria and since then celebrated by thousands of Freedom of Information Advocates around the globe.

Due to its impact, 28 September was recently recognized by the UNESCO as the International Day for the Universal Access to Information.

The Right to Know Day will be duly addressed by the European Commission in September 2017.

 

Being one of the founders of the Right to Know Day, for 15 years, the AIP holds the ceremony in Bulgaria.

At the Right to Know Day Awards Ceremony held on Sept. 28, the AIP gives the “Golden Key” awards to citizens, journalists, and NGOs, who have actively exercised their right of access to information and public bodies with excellent transparency practices. Institutions with bad transparency practices receive the “Padlock” anti-award.

The annual media outreach is of dozens publications, radio and TV shows.

The Right to Know Day is the strongest tool in the AIP campaign for encouraging the exercise of the right to information and pushing for enhanced government transparency and accountability.

In Bulgaria, the active, consistent and persistent exercise of the right to information, and the support provided by the AIP resulted in:

  • Proactive publication of information essential for effective public participation in decision and policy making of public bodies;
  • Disclosure of documents related to public funds expenditure, city planning and roads infrastructure;the health and safety of citizens; environmental protection; activities of public law organizations like hospitals, universities, and schools;
  • Free online access to the Trade Companies Register, the State Gazette; the Registers of Assets of High Ranking Officials; Public Procurements; Conflict of Interests Declarations; and decades of others;
  • Online access to government contracts and related documents.

In its 20 years of work, the AIP has cooperated and contributed to freedom of information campaigns in a number of countries in Europe, Africa, South and North America, Asia.

Help the AIP reach the goal of $10,000 to organize and hold the 15th Right to Know Day Awards Ceremony in Bulgaria on September 28 in support of its mission to assist the exercise of the right to information by monitoring legislation and implementation practices, participation in public and media debates, providing legal aid, and assisting litigation in courts, and by running raising awareness campaigns, and cooperating with national and international partners.

Everyone can contribute with a minimum of $5 or higher. Every contribution matters!

 

The Access to Information Programme is a Bulgarian nonprofit organization established in 1996. Our mission is to assist the exercise of the right to information. We are doing it by:

  • Monitoring and advocating for better Access to Information legislation;
  • Monitoring access to information practices;
  • Performing special surveys on access to information implementation practices and government transparency;
  • Maintaining a network of journalists in 27 regions in Bulgaria;
  • Preparing annual reports on the state of access to information;
  • Providing legal aid and representation in court on access to information cases;
  • Running campaigns to raise awareness on the right of access to information;
  • Holding FOI trainings for civil servants, journalists, and nongovernmental organizations;
  • Holding the Right to Know Day Awards Ceremony in Bulgaria on September 28;
  • Active participation in national and international networks advocating for freedom of information.

May we introduce you to Andy. A US Army combat vet of the Gulf War. He suffers from severe untreated PTSD and lives on the streets of Las Vegas, NV. He and 1000's of other homeless vets wander the streets of Las Vegas in 100 degree plus temperatures without sufficient water or food. Sadly he is used to people walking by or even stepping right over him without even acknowledging his existence. He has been called worthless, bum, waste of life, and has even had garbage thrown at him. This was a man who fought for the liberation of human beings he never met and will never know. He is a forgotten warrior and a man left behind.

With your generous donation we can bring a broken soul back home and help return his dignity and grace.

The Home Deployment project is an organization created by veterans for veterans. We are dedicated to increasing awareness for veteran issues such as combat PTSD, Depression, and homelessness. We strive to create programs geared towards helping veterans reintegrate back into society.

One of our most important projects is to bring food, water, and blankets to our homeless heroes. On any given night there are approximately 300,000 forgotten warriors sleeping on the streets of America. There are nearly 10,000 homeless vets in Las Vegas, NV alone.

We all know that our shelter system is broken. It suffers from severe overcrowding and on many cases must cater to families first. This country made a promise to care for our nations veterans and has failed. We must stop waiting for the system to fix itself and stand up as a community and give back to those who sacrificed for the liberties of this nation. We at least owe them that much.

Your generous contribution will help ensure we can continue our homeless food drives for the next 4 months.

If someone can raise nearly $50,000 to make potato salad, surely we can all sacrifice a little to help feed a homeless veteran.

We may not be able to change the world, but we can make a difference in one persons life by providing them with a much needed meal. We can bring a little hope to one person and give them enough strength to make it yet one more day.

Unfortunately we can't offer much in perks because every dollar goes towards efforts to support veterans. We are eternally grateful for any help.

We understand that not everyone is in a position to give financially. We ask that you at least share this campaign. Getting the word can be just as powerful as your dollar! Thank you and God bless us all...

story:
Empowering and supporting women in India and Kenya during the pandemic times. 

*ALL OUR COMMUNICATION HAPPENS THROUGH EMAIL, PLEASE CHECK YOUR INBOX AND SPAM.*

REMEMBER: TO GET ONE OF OUR PRODUCTS AS A REWARD, CLICK ON THE DONATION CATEGORY ON THE RIGHT SIDE – DONATIONS COMING FROM THE BUTTON  “BACK IT” DO NOT HAVE GIFTS INCLUDED.

ASSORTED GIFTS: NO OPTION TO CHOOSE COLORS AND DESIGN. 

*To know more about each reward, click on it on the right side to read the details. 

(PARA PORTUGUÊS ACESSAR LINK BENFEITORIA)

(FÜR DIE DEUTSCHE VERSION SIEHE WEITER UNTEN) - *Für deutsche Untertitel bitte auf das "Einstellungen"-Symbol im Video klicken *

The project:

Project Três inspires women through education and skills-training, becoming more self-reliant and active in community economic development, in India and Kenya. We believe that providing education on fair trade and self-sustainability is the key to create new life-changing economic and social opportunities. 

 

In light of the recent global pandemic, we are not able to provide the support that all the artisans need. In addition, the ones that secured jobs outside our project with our help, are no longer working due to the consequences of Covid-19.

 

The women:

Our work allows women with limited education and experience to become financially stable, foster positive social networks, care for their children, and improve their overall quality of life. In India, we call them our ladies and in Kenya, they are our mamas. They are family to us. These women are mothers, daughters, sisters, friends, housewives, and refugees. Some of them have experienced domestic violence, divorce, acid attacks, and had little access to education. 

 

The challenges:

The solutions:

WHAT ARE WE GOING TO USE THE MONEY FOR:

The vision:

To navigate successfully through the pandemic having experienced little long term impact on the women’s mental and physical health. To ensure that they don’t lose forward progression made before the pandemic.

 

Project Três believes in the principles of making an impact on the global challenges we face, always pledging to work towards the 2030 UN Sustainability Goals. At present, we have taken on eight out of the seventeen goals. We are actively committed to achieving Goal 5: Gender Equality; Goal 10: Reduced Inequalities; Goal 12: Responsible Production Consumption. During pandemic times we have shifted our focus to Goal 1: No Poverty; and Goal 2: Zero Hunger.

REWARDS:

 

SIZE T-SHIRTS - APPLIES TO ALL DESIGNS 

Measurements Guideline:

Chest:

S = 45,5 cm

M = 47,0 cm

L = 50,0 cm

XL = 52,5 cm

Bottom:

S = 47,0 cm

M = 50,0 cm

L = 52,0 cm

XL = 55 cm

Length:

S = 67,0 cm

M = 68,5 cm

L = 69,5 cm

XL = 71,5 cm

 

MALE:

 

Chest:

S = 50 cm

M = 55,0 cm

L = 60,0 cm

Bottom:

S = 47,5 cm

M = 52,5 cm

L = 57,5 cm

Length:

S = 74,6 cm

M = 75,5 cm

L = 77,0 cm

 

PRODUCTION + SHIPMENT GUIDELINE:

 

DEUTSCHE VERSION:

 

Das Projekt:

Project Três ist ein soziales Projekt zur Förderung der wirtschaftlichen und finanziellen Unabhängigkeit von Frauen in Indien und Kenia. Durch unsere gezielten Bildungsprogramme und Handwerksausbildungen helfen unsere Frauen aktiv bei der wirtschaftlichen Entwicklung der Gemeinschaft. Wir glauben, dass Bildung, fairer Handel und Nachhaltigkeit der Schlüssel zur Schaffung neuer lebensverändernder, wirtschaftlicher und sozialer Möglichkeiten ist.

 

Angesichts der jüngsten globalen Pandemie können wir nicht die Unterstützung bieten, die unsere Frauen benötigen. Darüber hinaus haben viele Frauen einen Arbeitsplatz verloren, die wir mit unserer finanziellen Hilfe aus dem Projekt gesichert wurde.

 

Die Frauen:

Unsere Arbeit ermöglicht es Frauen mit begrenzter Ausbildung und Erfahrung, finanziell unabhängig zu werden, positive soziale Netzwerke zu fördern, für ihre Kinder zu sorgen und ihre allgemeine Lebensqualität zu verbessern. In Indien nennen wir sie unsere Damen und in Kenia sind sie unsere Mamas. Sie sind eine Familie für uns. Diese Frauen sind Mütter, Töchter, Schwestern, Freunde, Hausfrauen und Flüchtlinge. Einige von ihnen haben häusliche Gewalt, Scheidung und Säureangriffe erlebt und hatten kaum Zugang zu Bildung.

 

Die Herausforderungen:

Aufrechterhaltung der Arbeitsmöglichkeiten und Unterstützung der Frauen im Projekt während der Pandemie

Mangel an Arbeitsmöglichkeiten

Unterstützung und Aufklärung über Empowerment und Eigenständigkeit, wie finanzielle Unabhängigkeit, Vertrauensentwicklung, Entscheidungsprozesse und Selbstmotivation

Schutz für Frauen und ihre Familien, die häuslicher Gewalt ausgesetzt sind

Verbesserung des Zugangs zum Gesundheitssystem für unsere Frauen und deren Familien

 

Unsere Lösungen:

Aufrechterhaltung der Arbeitsmöglichkeiten für unsere Frauen während der Pandemie

Hilfe bei Nahrungsmitteln (vor allem jetzt während der Pandemie!)

Bildungsprogramme zur Planung der eigenen Finanzen

Finanzielle Unterstützung für körperliche und geistige Gesundheit + Therapiesitzungen

Entwicklung von Kleinstunternehmen

Unser Zentrum in Kenia und Indien, welches als Arbeitsplatz und Notunterkunft für Bedürftige (z.B. bei häuslicher Gewalt oder nach einer Scheidung) bereit steht

 

Unsere Vision:

Erfolgreich durch die Pandemie zu navigieren, ohne dass sich dies langfristig auf die geistige und körperliche Gesundheit der Frauen auswirkt. Unsere vor der Pandemie erreichten Fortschritte z.B. die Gründung von Kleinstunternehmen sicherstellen.

 

Project Três glaubt an die Grundsätze, die globalen Herausforderungen zu bewältigen, und verpflichtet sich stets, auf die UN-Nachhaltigkeitsziele 2030 hinzuarbeiten. Gegenwärtig haben wir acht der siebzehn Ziele erzielt. Wir setzen uns aktiv für die Erreichung von Ziel 5 ein: Gleichstellung der Geschlechter; Ziel 10: Reduzierung der Ungleichheiten; Ziel 12: Verantwortungsbewusster Produktionsverbrauch. Während der Pandemie haben wir unseren Fokus auf Ziel 1 verlagert: Keine Armut; und Ziel 2: Kein Hunger.

 

Geldaufschlüsselung:

6000 EUR INDIEGOGO

1,560 EUR Nahrungsmittel für 30 Frauen + Familien für 2 Monate

1,750 EUR Gehälter + Nebenkosten (Miete, Wasser, Elektrizität) für 2 Monate

1,290 EUR Schulkosten für 4 Kinden für 12 Monate

800 EUR Kosten für die Kampagne

600 EUR 10% Steuern für Indiegogo 

 

R$ 15.000 BENFEITORIA (ca. 3000 EUR)

R$ 4.430 Nahrungsmittel für 30 Frauen + Familien für 1 Monat

R$ 4.970  Gehälter + Nebenkosten (Miete, Wasser, Elektrizität) für 1 Monat

R$ 1.850  Schulkosten für 1 Kind für 12 Monate

R$ 2.250 Kosten für die Kampagne

R$ 1.500 10% Steuern für Indiegogo

 

*Durch die Kombination unserer internationalen und brasilianischen Kampagne wollen wir 9.000 Euro sammeln.
story_txt: Empowering and supporting women in India and Kenya during the pandemic times. *ALL OUR COMMUNICATION HAPPENS THROUGH EMAIL, PLEASE CHECK YOUR INBOX AND SPAM.*REMEMBER: TO GET ONE OF OUR PRODUCTS AS A REWARD, CLICK ON THE DONATION CATEGORY ON THE RIGHT SIDE – DONATIONS COMING FROM THE BUTTON  “BACK IT” DO NOT HAVE GIFTS INCLUDED.ASSORTED GIFTS: NO OPTION TO CHOOSE COLORS AND DESIGN. *To know more about each reward, click on it on the right side to read the details. (PARA PORTUGUÊS ACESSAR LINK BENFEITORIA)(FÜR DIE DEUTSCHE VERSION SIEHE WEITER UNTEN) - *Für deutsche Untertitel bitte auf das "Einstellungen"-Symbol im Video klicken *The project:Project Três inspires women through education and skills-training, becoming more self-reliant and active in community economic development, in India and Kenya. We believe that providing education on fair trade and self-sustainability is the key to create new life-changing economic and social opportunities.  In light of the recent global pandemic, we are not able to provide the support that all the artisans need. In addition, the ones that secured jobs outside our project with our help, are no longer working due to the consequences of Covid-19. The women:Our work allows women with limited education and experience to become financially stable, foster positive social networks, care for their children, and improve their overall quality of life. In India, we call them our ladies and in Kenya, they are our mamas. They are family to us. These women are mothers, daughters, sisters, friends, housewives, and refugees. Some of them have experienced domestic violence, divorce, acid attacks, and had little access to education.  The challenges:The solutions:WHAT ARE WE GOING TO USE THE MONEY FOR:The vision:To navigate successfully through the pandemic having experienced little long term impact on the women’s mental and physical health. To ensure that they don’t lose forward progression made before the pandemic. Project Três believes in the principles of making an impact on the global challenges we face, always pledging to work towards the 2030 UN Sustainability Goals. At present, we have taken on eight out of the seventeen goals. We are actively committed to achieving Goal 5: Gender Equality; Goal 10: Reduced Inequalities; Goal 12: Responsible Production Consumption. During pandemic times we have shifted our focus to Goal 1: No Poverty; and Goal 2: Zero Hunger.REWARDS: SIZE T-SHIRTS - APPLIES TO ALL DESIGNS Measurements Guideline:Chest:S = 45,5 cmM = 47,0 cmL = 50,0 cmXL = 52,5 cmBottom:S = 47,0 cmM = 50,0 cmL = 52,0 cmXL = 55 cmLength:S = 67,0 cmM = 68,5 cmL = 69,5 cmXL = 71,5 cm MALE: Chest:S = 50 cmM = 55,0 cmL = 60,0 cmBottom:S = 47,5 cmM = 52,5 cmL = 57,5 cmLength:S = 74,6 cmM = 75,5 cmL = 77,0 cm PRODUCTION + SHIPMENT GUIDELINE: DEUTSCHE VERSION: Das Projekt:Project Três ist ein soziales Projekt zur Förderung der wirtschaftlichen und finanziellen Unabhängigkeit von Frauen in Indien und Kenia. Durch unsere gezielten Bildungsprogramme und Handwerksausbildungen helfen unsere Frauen aktiv bei der wirtschaftlichen Entwicklung der Gemeinschaft. Wir glauben, dass Bildung, fairer Handel und Nachhaltigkeit der Schlüssel zur Schaffung neuer lebensverändernder, wirtschaftlicher und sozialer Möglichkeiten ist. Angesichts der jüngsten globalen Pandemie können wir nicht die Unterstützung bieten, die unsere Frauen benötigen. Darüber hinaus haben viele Frauen einen Arbeitsplatz verloren, die wir mit unserer finanziellen Hilfe aus dem Projekt gesichert wurde. Die Frauen:Unsere Arbeit ermöglicht es Frauen mit begrenzter Ausbildung und Erfahrung, finanziell unabhängig zu werden, positive soziale Netzwerke zu fördern, für ihre Kinder zu sorgen und ihre allgemeine Lebensqualität zu verbessern. In Indien nennen wir sie unsere Damen und in Kenia sind sie unsere Mamas. Sie sind eine Familie für uns. Diese Frauen sind Mütter, Töchter, Schwestern, Freunde, Hausfrauen und Flüchtlinge. Einige von ihnen haben häusliche Gewalt, Scheidung und Säureangriffe erlebt und hatten kaum Zugang zu Bildung. Die Herausforderungen:Aufrechterhaltung der Arbeitsmöglichkeiten und Unterstützung der Frauen im Projekt während der PandemieMangel an ArbeitsmöglichkeitenUnterstützung und Aufklärung über Empowerment und Eigenständigkeit, wie finanzielle Unabhängigkeit, Vertrauensentwicklung, Entscheidungsprozesse und SelbstmotivationSchutz für Frauen und ihre Familien, die häuslicher Gewalt ausgesetzt sindVerbesserung des Zugangs zum Gesundheitssystem für unsere Frauen und deren Familien Unsere Lösungen:Aufrechterhaltung der Arbeitsmöglichkeiten für unsere Frauen während der PandemieHilfe bei Nahrungsmitteln (vor allem jetzt während der Pandemie!)Bildungsprogramme zur Planung der eigenen FinanzenFinanzielle Unterstützung für körperliche und geistige Gesundheit + TherapiesitzungenEntwicklung von KleinstunternehmenUnser Zentrum in Kenia und Indien, welches als Arbeitsplatz und Notunterkunft für Bedürftige (z.B. bei häuslicher Gewalt oder nach einer Scheidung) bereit steht Unsere Vision:Erfolgreich durch die Pandemie zu navigieren, ohne dass sich dies langfristig auf die geistige und körperliche Gesundheit der Frauen auswirkt. Unsere vor der Pandemie erreichten Fortschritte z.B. die Gründung von Kleinstunternehmen sicherstellen. Project Três glaubt an die Grundsätze, die globalen Herausforderungen zu bewältigen, und verpflichtet sich stets, auf die UN-Nachhaltigkeitsziele 2030 hinzuarbeiten. Gegenwärtig haben wir acht der siebzehn Ziele erzielt. Wir setzen uns aktiv für die Erreichung von Ziel 5 ein: Gleichstellung der Geschlechter; Ziel 10: Reduzierung der Ungleichheiten; Ziel 12: Verantwortungsbewusster Produktionsverbrauch. Während der Pandemie haben wir unseren Fokus auf Ziel 1 verlagert: Keine Armut; und Ziel 2: Kein Hunger. Geldaufschlüsselung:6000 EUR INDIEGOGO1,560 EUR Nahrungsmittel für 30 Frauen + Familien für 2 Monate1,750 EUR Gehälter + Nebenkosten (Miete, Wasser, Elektrizität) für 2 Monate1,290 EUR Schulkosten für 4 Kinden für 12 Monate800 EUR Kosten für die Kampagne600 EUR 10% Steuern für Indiegogo  R$ 15.000 BENFEITORIA (ca. 3000 EUR)R$ 4.430 Nahrungsmittel für 30 Frauen + Familien für 1 MonatR$ 4.970  Gehälter + Nebenkosten (Miete, Wasser, Elektrizität) für 1 MonatR$ 1.850  Schulkosten für 1 Kind für 12 MonateR$ 2.250 Kosten für die KampagneR$ 1.500 10% Steuern für Indiegogo *Durch die Kombination unserer internationalen und brasilianischen Kampagne wollen wir 9.000 Euro sammeln.

story:
Summary

For people with disabilities a job is more than just a paycheck.  A job means dignity and a sense of purpose, friendships and community.  Yet over 80% of people with intellectual and developmental disabilities are unemployed, despite research that shows that disabled people can often perform as well or better than their non-disabled counterparts. 

So my wife and I decided to build a coffee shop and design it to make jobs more accessible for people with disabilities.  As a special educator she knows that thousands of people are living lives of isolation needlessly, and as a consultant and business analyst I brought a knowledge of new technologies in food service to the table.  We selected a fantastic location in Burlington, Vermont and built the store ourselves to save money. 

After just one month in business we received notification from the City that they were shutting down the street in front of our store for an additional 6 months to replace the storm water system and remove contaminated soils.  We knew about this project when we signed the lease and are excited about having a new, state of the art walkable and bikeable street.  We carefully planned our lease start to coincide with the street being reopened, and built a 30 day cushion in to our plans.  This sudden, unexpected and as of yet not adequately explained 6 month extension of the street closure has resulted in a 75% loss of business.  Projecting this loss out through the summer is unsustainable for our small business.

What We Need & What You Get

We purchased a state-of-the art coffee roaster to roast specialty coffee for our shop.  Our roaster is all electric and we offset the power consumption with 35 leased solar panels.  Our filtration system captures virtually all the smoke and odors so the particulates don't end up in the air.  Since it is so hard to get to our shop, we are bringing our roasted coffee to you. 

  • Our goal is to produce $25,000 in roasted coffee sales.  This income will be used to fulfill orders, pay wages, and help with operating expenses while the construction lasts.
  • We custom-roast small batch specialty coffee, many produced by Women Coffee Producers.  Our coffee is ethically sourced and sustainably grown.
  • All funds will be used to fulfill coffee orders first.  Our roaster is purchased, our green stock is in hand, and our roast master is eager to get to work fulfilling your order.

The Impact

We have always felt that if given a level playing field that people with disabilities can perform as well as or better than their non-disabled counterparts.  While we now know that our employees can compete with anyone, the playing field is not level.  A coffee shop must be easily accessible to the public in order to survive and the road closure has severely hindered that.  As it stands, our coffee shop will have to endure the first 250 days of its existence cut off from the community due to this unplanned extended road closure.

  • Our goal is to perfect a business model that will provide meaningful, competitively paid and inclusive employment to people with disabilities.
  • Once proven, this model can be rolled out in a variety of industries, providing hope and opportunities to many, their families and caregivers.
  • Jobs can foster dignity and respect, understanding and a sense of community. Our coffee shop provides opportunities to those that have none.

Risks & Challenges

We have already been notified of three road-project extensions.  There is no guarantee that we will not face another.  Should that happen we will continue to focus our energies on internet coffee sales and wholesale/retail coffee sales.

  • We are currently roasting every day.  Our roaster is small with a 10 lb per hour capacity.
  • Should we be unable to keep up with demand, we will consider leasing a second roaster.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please consider spreading the word about our campaign.  We also have a gofundme page available at https://www.gofundme.com/f/provide-lifesupport-...

  • Please help us spread the word.  Our coffee subscriptions make a great gift!
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

This is a joint initiative for and by the LGBT community in Cyprus to address the fact that people are biased towards LGBT groups and LGBT groups in turn feel restrained and confined in their own country! We have launched this campaign to help people open up to the LGBT Community and see beyond the self imposed stereotypes imposed by closed societies! We want to get people involved and help them overcome their emotional spiritual and physical restrains! 

we have created the OPENNESS MOVEMENT which is based on 3 PILLARS;

OPEN MINDS, OPENS HEARTS, OPEN ARMS 

and we encourage people to get involved to the level they want to get involved.

Each Level designates where you stand: 

Open Minds -> I support the freedom for Sexual Orientation

Open Hearts-> I support the movement and act according to its goals

Open Arms -> I believe in the movement and will fight for its cause

 

Cyprus is a close community and we are trying to help spread the word and start one of the biggest campaigns to help people undestand us!

We have setup and paid ouf of our own funds the website and paid for all expenses to help us build our cause! We have spent 12,000 euros  (15,000 usd) on fees and designers and web programmers. We would like to recover some or all of the amount!

We are going global to create a movement for LGBT internationally!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have spent (and still are spending.....):

> 2500 Euro on Designer fees 

> 1000 Euro on legal and accounting fees

> 5000 Euro on programmer fees and translator fees (cos' this will be translated in major languages)

> 2500 Euro on hardware, travelling and other expenses

> 1000 on Printing fees

 

Any additional funds we receive will help us use and pay for global exposure channels to make this happen.

All contributions will receive a thsirt with our logo and motto! (except the 10USD perk)

The thsirts are the same for all contributors, you just tell us the size you wear!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

> If you simply want to help without getting a tshirt then simply select the 10 USD perk!

> All other perks will receive a tshirt!

> Visit the website and purchase the tshirt you like!

> Spread the word!

 

FYI: 

 Any extra money raised will be given to various WELL-RESPECTED charities

 

Thank you all

story:
$1 provides 10 meals for people facing hunger.  

(100% of contributions go directly to Feeding America minus standard payment processing fees. No Indiegogo fees will be taken) 



Our Story
When we started @HiddenCash, it was with the intention of giving back to the community, in a fun way. It was never meant to be an act of charity. As we made clear from the beginning, we also do give to various charities when the opportunity arises and we are able to. Nevertheless, a frequent criticism we heard was "why don't you give to those who really need it?". Well, we always did, but now we want to do it with you. 
For the first time ever since we started @Hiddencash, we are asking YOU, our followers, to join us this holiday season. We want to do this together, to raise money and awareness to feed the hungry. Millions of people right here in the richest country in the world go hungry. Families, fathers, mothers, and - worst of all - helpless children. 

Your Impact: 

For every $1 donated, the Feeding America network of food banks will secure and distribute 10 meals to people facing hunger.   


Perks: 

In addition to helping feed people in hunger, your contribution can get you some fun perks - including a replica of our Fox mascot (cash gifted to Feeding America)!  

(Have a perk you'd like for us to offer? Let us know what and the amount in the comments) 

Why Feeding America? 
Inspired by one of our role models, Tony Robbins (TEDTalk), who has been involved with Feeding America for many years, we started a campaign to raise money to help this wonderful organization feed thousands of families across America.
We are asking for your help, and have some cool rewards for those who help. But giving is its own reward. Do you know that researchers discovered that giving makes people happier than anything else they can do with their money? We can personally testify to that, as Hiddencash and other less celebrated projects we have done have personally shown us.  #TheSecretToLivingIsGiving


Join us: 
During this holiday season, we ask that you please help us feed those who need it most. Whether or not you contribute, please join us in sharing the campaign with your friends and family. Together, we can create a better world.
-Your friends @Hiddencash

(100% of contributions go directly to Feeding America minus standard payment processing fees. No Indiegogo fees will be taken.)

story:
Help child refugees now!

Global Shapers Hub Sarajevo in collaboration with the association Pomozi.ba, War Childhood Museum from Sarajevo and Divac Foundation from Serbia is launching a campaign to help refugees that are temporarily situated in Western Balkans on their long journey to Western European countries.

Fleeing from war devastated homes and in search of a dignified life, thousands of refugees keep arriving in Europe each day. Those who reach the European soil are considered lucky, because many refugees lose their lives in attempt to cross Mediterranean Sea. But, their battle doesn’t end once they reach the European soil. Emotionally broken after leaving their homes, still in fear of the horror they have survived and with even higher anticipation of what is waiting for them, they start their journey to the Western European countries. One common refugee’s route is crossing through our neighboring countries – Serbia and Croatia. The terrors of war that we have experienced in the Balkans during the nineties are now what the citizens of Syria, Afghanistan and Iraq are going through in the past few years. The road to a safer life is often burdened with bureaucracy, reluctance of governments and paved with selfishness of certain people in power. 

Children make a large portion of refugees creating the highest level of refugee children since World War II. Without a roof, dry clothing and food they are especially susceptible to malnutrition and diseases related to poor sanitation. Many suffer from diarrheal diseases and dehydration.

Being outraged isn't enough. Help us bring essential necessities to their lives. We plan to collect and buy necessary items - food, clothing, diapers, strollers, baby carriers and feeding bottles etc -   and make child packages which will be distributed to children and families in need.  

How can you help?

  • Donate – we will make sure that help reaches those in need,

  • Get active online – share this campaign with your friends on social networks,

  • Spread the word – send the link containing campaign information to your mailing list.

If you need any additional information regarding the campaign please feel free to contact us at info@gssarajevo.org.

For making this Initiative possible and in the name of those in need we thank you for your support,

Global Shapers Hub Sarajevo

Who are we?

We are Global Shapers Hub Sarajevo and part of Global Shapers Community established by World Economic Forum. Our community is a network of hubs from more than 300 world cities led by young leaders between 20 and 30 years old. What connects us is the desire to improve our local communities.

story:
The UK is moving dangerously close to internet censorship and we need your help to stop it!

Recently the Government, with the help of religious lobby groups, has persuaded ISP’s to introduce an internet filter across the UK. 

It’s a bad idea that doesn’t work, is dangerous for internet freedom and could give parents a false sense of security when it comes to their children’s use of the internet.

We need your help to launch a campaign to make the UK public aware of this important issue. It will be led by a funny and pointed video that will show people why this filter is bad for them and their families.

It’s been developed by the advertising creatives who were behind the campaign that helped kill off plans for an internet filter in Australia. The Australian Prime Minister of the time even admitted as much!

We need your help to raise £12,000 to get this campaign off the ground. So if this is an issue that is important to you, please donate now and help us raise awareness about internet filtering in the UK!

Internet filtering is a slippery slope

Every major internet service provider in the UK is promoting filters that block websites that contain material that isn’t appropriate for children. This means that your internet service provider gets to decide what you can or can’t see online, regardless of how old you are.

Recently, the government asked to add secret extremist website lists to the blacklist as well so we can only expect that this list will grow and grow. Then there’s the problem that a whole load of sites get blocked by mistake - from churches (they mention wine!) to political blogs that have been miscategorised as hate speech. And a lot of sites that children should have access to - such as sites on sexual health - are also blocked. Once your website is on a blocked list, there’s no easy way to get off it.

Giving parents a false sense of security

Let’s be honest, no one wants their kids seeing porn or stuff that might upset them but David Cameron’s suggestion of, "one click to protect your whole home and keep your children safe" is deeply irresponsible. It may come as a surprise to Cameron but parents might need to act like grown ups when it comes to adult content. Talking about porn, extremism or self-harming sites might not come naturally to most of us. But we have a responsibility to equip our children with the skills they need to navigate their way in the digital world - just as we do in the non-digital world. Filters don’t do that.

If parents want to switch on filters, that is their choice. But it should be an informed choice and there are alternatives to default filters, such as device-level filters, which are more effective.

If parents don’t want filters, they shouldn’t be made to feel ashamed or that they are failing as a parent because they’ve decided to take responsibility for how their kids use the internet. If you don’t have kids, then there is absolutely no reason you should feel pressurised into switching them on.

Filters don't solve society's problems

Filters are harmful for people who are browsing for information about domestic violence, safe sex or drugs health but they are not going to stop a tech-savvy teenager who is determined to find adult content.

If it turns out the public don’t want filters to censor what they see online, then politicians will start asking for blocks that are even harder to switch off. They will continue to claim that filters can solve every social ill. We have to discredit this ridiculous idea. We don’t have to put up with censorship just to make their lives easier. Support this campaign so we can show exactly how stupid filters are.

Filters are not just an attack on free speech, they don’t work. Help us to fight them.
story_txt:
The UK is moving dangerously close to internet censorship and we need your help to stop it!

Recently the Government, with the help of religious lobby groups, has persuaded ISP’s to introduce an internet filter across the UK. 
It’s a bad idea that doesn’t work, is dangerous for internet freedom and could give parents a false sense of security when it comes to their children’s use of the internet.
We need your help to launch a campaign to make the UK public aware of this important issue. It will be led by a funny and pointed video that will show people why this filter is bad for them and their families.
It’s been developed by the advertising creatives who were behind the campaign that helped kill off plans for an internet filter in Australia. The Australian Prime Minister of the time even admitted as much!
We need your help to raise £12,000 to get this campaign off the ground. So if this is an issue that is important to you, please donate now and help us raise awareness about internet filtering in the UK!Internet filtering is a slippery slope

Every major internet service provider in the UK is promoting filters that block websites that contain material that isn’t appropriate for children. This means that your internet service provider gets to decide what you can or can’t see online, regardless of how old you are.
Recently, the government asked to add secret extremist website lists to the blacklist as well so we can only expect that this list will grow and grow. Then there’s the problem that a whole load of sites get blocked by mistake - from churches (they mention wine!) to political blogs that have been miscategorised as hate speech. And a lot of sites that children should have access to - such as sites on sexual health - are also blocked. Once your website is on a blocked list, there’s no easy way to get off it.Giving parents a false sense of security

Let’s be honest, no one wants their kids seeing porn or stuff that might upset them but David Cameron’s suggestion of, "one click to protect your whole home and keep your children safe" is deeply irresponsible. It may come as a surprise to Cameron but parents might need to act like grown ups when it comes to adult content. Talking about porn, extremism or self-harming sites might not come naturally to most of us. But we have a responsibility to equip our children with the skills they need to navigate their way in the digital world - just as we do in the non-digital world. Filters don’t do that.
If parents want to switch on filters, that is their choice. But it should be an informed choice and there are alternatives to default filters, such as device-level filters, which are more effective.
If parents don’t want filters, they shouldn’t be made to feel ashamed or that they are failing as a parent because they’ve decided to take responsibility for how their kids use the internet. If you don’t have kids, then there is absolutely no reason you should feel pressurised into switching them on.Filters don't solve society's problems

Filters are harmful for people who are browsing for information about domestic violence, safe sex or drugs health but they are not going to stop a tech-savvy teenager who is determined to find adult content.
If it turns out the public don’t want filters to censor what they see online, then politicians will start asking for blocks that are even harder to switch off. They will continue to claim that filters can solve every social ill. We have to discredit this ridiculous idea. We don’t have to put up with censorship just to make their lives easier. Support this campaign so we can show exactly how stupid filters are.
Filters are not just an attack on free speech, they don’t work. Help us to fight them.

story:
Hello, My name is Dennis King.

     I am undertaking this project because a friend of mine was a homeless veteran. His name was Dwight. I did everything I could to help get him off the streets. I took him to drug rehab centers, had him stay at my place whenever I could get him to agree to stay. I made sure he had a job with my construction business. I even took him to the Veterans Affairs Hospital on many occasions for treatment of the ailments of which he was afflicted. Dwight had post traumatic stress disorder among other ailments. I tried to help him get all of the benefits that were rightfully his. It was very difficult watching a friend deteriorate right before my eyes.
 

     On a Friday evening after I had paid him for the work he did that week, we sat in my van and had a very honest conversation. Dwight told me he appreciated everything I had done for him. He said I was the only one in his life who really cared what happened to him. He said that because of all of the things I had done for him that he was gaining the confidence to do more for himself. I told him I was glad to hear him say that and offered to let him stay at my place that night. He declined and asked me to drop him off at one of his regular spots. He got out of the van and I told him I would pick him up the next morning. He said OK, I'll see you then.

     The next morning as I approached the location where I was to pick him up for  work that day I noticed several police cars were in the area. I parked my van, got out and approached one of the officers. I asked the officer what had happened. I told him I was there to pick up one of my workers. He took the opportunity to ask me if I knew the victim. I said yes and asked what happened. He said the victim was dead and that he needed for me to give a statement and to help contact Dwight's next of kin.

      I later learned from the medical examiners office that he died from blunt force trauma to the head.

Many times I have asked myself if Dwight had had a place of his own, would things have turned out differently that night?

     More has got to be done for our veterans. 

                    Your help is sorely needed.

      You may know someone who is a veteran. A brother, sister, mother, father,uncle, aunt or friend!

     Let me ask you this - How is it that a country which enjoys all of the freedoms and privileges as the The United States does, allow any one of the individuals who have fought the battles to make those freedoms and privileges possible, become homeless?

                                                             Did You Know?

                                                                        40%

                                             Of homeless men are veterans?

                                                                    200,000

            Homeless veterans sleep on the streets of America every night?

                                                                         76%

  Of homeless veterans experience alcohol, drug, or mental health problems?

 

Here in Baltimore Maryland:
 

     On any given night, surveys indicate there are about 300 veterans experiencing homelessness, and maybe significantly more given the difficulty of conducting an accurate census of those on the streets. This number has remained steady since at least 2009.

     The Department of Veterans Affairs is doing what it can to help address the problem in a meaningful way. However, their efforts need to be supplemented with all manner of private sector efforts to help eradicate this problem.

 

With your help we can make a huge difference towards eliminating homelessness not only in Baltimore but all across America.

What We Need & What You Get

 

   Although this is a pilot project, if all goes well we will purchase and renovate more buildings for veteran housing. We have acquired and plan to renovate the rowhouse in the video above into efficiency apartments to provide affordable housing for up to eight homeless male and female veterans.

     I realize this is a small number, but every new housing accommodation  represents a step in the right direction.

 

     Our overall need is $150,000. However, this first phase is designed to fund the architectural plans and permits needed to get the project started. Later phases will help fund renovation costs in order to make this project successful. The money you contribute will all go directly towards costs related to renovating and furnishing  the building. Everyone who donates will receive a weekly update as to the progress that has been made that particular week.

      If we don't reach our entire goal, the funds we do raise will go towards helping us get as far along as we can.

 

                                                          Did You Know?

                                                                    50%

              Of homeless female veterans are under the age of 35.

                                                                55,000

  Homeless female veterans sleep on the streets of America every night?

                                                                    92%

    Of homeless female veterans have experienced some form of sexual      

    aggravation?

 

    The Impact

         Simply having affordable housing will help alleviate the primary causes of homelessness among veterans which are:

    1. Lack of income due to limited education and lack of transferable skills from military to civilian life.

    2. Combat-related physical health issues and disabilities.

    3. Combat-related mental health issues and disabilities.

    4. Substance abuse problems that interfere with job retention.

    5. Weak social networks due to problems adjusting to civilian life.

    6. Lack of services.

          In addition to providing housing, we will also provide assistance with helping our veterans gain access to the social services they deserve.
     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If for some reason you can't afford to make a monetary contribution, please spread the word about this campaign to your friends relatives and acquaintances.

    Help get the word out about this issue and this campaign through every way possible. You can use the share tools that Indiegogo has made available.

     

    Your Contribution Will Make A Difference!

story:
I want to reach out and share this wonderful opportunity for contribution to a survivors life. Make these holidays special for someone who has been through traumatic experiences.

We would greatly appreciate your contributions!

This is an opportunity for holidays to support a survivor and their family. If you would like to bring happiness to a family after their traumatic experience and make their vacation magical, please do contribute.  Peace Over Violence’s Holiday Gift Card Drive is an annual donation effort that Peace Over Violence implements to give additional support to our clients and their families during the holiday season.  Our goal is to acquire gift cards to different places such as Target, Food 4 Less, Walmart, Vons, other grocery stores, etc.  This allows for survivors to get a wider range of necessities for their families. 

Peace Over Violence is a  social service agency dedicated to the elimination of sexual and domestic violence and all forms of interpersonal violence. We understand violence in relationships, families and communities is a root cause for violence in society. To address the problem at its core is to change how this problem manifests and magnifies itself in society at large. Changing an individual point of view toward sexual, domestic and interpersonal violence will — one on one, one by one — cause social change, a transformation of society, a world without violence.

 

We appreciate your support!!!

story:
The Situation

Our life-long friend Bettie needs our help as she begins fighting to relocate from Colorado back home to Texas with her twins.

 

Maybe like a lot of you, I can't stand to hear stories of domestic violence and abuse. When I had first heard about the years of abuse she endured, I thought it sounded like a movie on the Lifetime channel it was so horrific! Though she was finally able to get away from her abuser with the help of Victim's Advocates, she is now in the beginnings of a legal battle with him and the state, just to be able to leave his town and move back home with her children.

 

We've known Bettie for over 30 years, and she is without a doubt the kindest, friendliest, most empathetic and giving person I know! She would do most anything for anyone, but is the last person in the world to ask for help. She is very dear to me, and that's why I have decided to quietly raise some much needed funds for her and the kids. Now it's our turn to help HER as she fights to gain the freedom to come home to her friends and family who love her so much!

Bottom Line

Long story short, she needs help with legal fees, moving expenses and interim living expenses. Like anything else, the court will have the final decision. But without resources to fight, the book is already closed. So, please join me and let's help Bettie win this fight and be an example to other survivors of domestic violence that the cycle of abuse CAN be broken!

 

PS

Your generosity is very much appreciated by all of us! Beside the perks, the Contribute button allows you to give any amount you wish, and feel free to alter the default amount to anything you can do.

 Thank you for supporting this cause and making a difference! Every little bit helps, and so do your prayers.

 

A special note for FB friends of Bettie:

Even if we don't reach our goal, we would like to present the proceeds of this fundraiser to Bettie as a surprise gift when our time runs out. Also, the more we share the website link, the better our chances of reaching that goal! With that in mind, sharing privately will keep the cat in the bag and off her wall and make it that much more special! Thanks again everyone, let's do this! :)
